cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles W of Port Charlotte, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then turning northwest to north-northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast (southeastern Louisiana–Mississippi coast)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast between Grand Isle, LA and Ocean Springs, MS

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch from Mississippi/Alabama border to Alabama/Florida border; Hurricane watch east of Ocean Springs, MS to the Alabama/Florida border; Tropical-storm watch Indian Pass to Ochlockonee River, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm-surge warning Port Fourchon, LA to MS/AL border including Lake Pontchartrain/Maurepas; Hurricane warning Grand Isle, LA to Ocean Springs, MS; Tropical-storm warning east of Ocean Springs, MS to Indian Pass, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast (southeastern Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, far W Florida Panhandle)
weather_observation.wind: Only a very small (≈3%) chance of experiencing tropical-storm-force gusts late in the 5-day period; otherwise breezy conditions at most.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the South Carolina coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring periods of showers late week, but widespread heavy totals are not anticipated in Charleston.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip-current risk along the Southeast U.S. coast from distant swells.
